body:
The whole validation thing in Cake is quite buggy, as pointed out earlier ( https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/12697 ).
It doesn't help that the argument count can vary, and context can be at any position of validation rules, depending on what other arguments are available.

As soon as the validation provider is configured in any way, even core rules fail with the above.

The main reason seems to be that in this case, the 3rd arg is set with this array instead as $context instead of the expected $regex:
```php
[
'newRecord' => false,
'data' => [
    ...
],
'field' => 'weight',
'providers' => [ ],
]
```

This feels also somewhat related to https://github.com/cakephp/localized/issues/252#issuecomment-2097715729
I guess we could try to make the API a bit more straightforward in terms of args.

> The main reason seems to be that in this case, the 3rd arg is set with this array instead as $context instead of the expected $regex

That's the case. `Validator::decimal()` uses only 1 argument with config like `'rule' => ['decimal', $places]`. Then because of `$args = array_values(array_merge([$value], $this->_pass, [$context]));` in `ValidationRule::process()` the context array gets passed as value for the 2nd argument `$regex` of `Validation::decimal()`.

So with the current implementation if a validation method has additional args you must either pass all the args or none to avoid this error. I can't think of any other way besides reflection to avoid this problem.

So the above magic happens due to this

https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/e15d186e05e9e02231d53ba3bb6daa9290c3a470/src/Validation/RulesProvider.php#L74-L76

This is what alllows this magic

https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/e15d186e05e9e02231d53ba3bb6daa9290c3a470/src/Validation/Validator.php#L324-L333

So by default `getProvider('default')` will return an instance of `RulesProvider` which does the args juggling before calling the validation methods of `Validation`. But since you used `addDefaultProvider()` to set `default` to your own class all the magic was gone.

**The fix is to use**
```
 \Cake\Validation\Validator::addDefaultProvider('default', new \Cake\Validation\RulesProvider(\App\Validation\Validation::class));
```

I can confirm that the workaround works :)

I documented it for the CakeDecimal plugin: https://github.com/dereuromark/cakephp-decimal/commit/246a6c82a975b72f5d19ea41f5516c40e856cb79

issue.title: Fix context array being passed for optional argument of validation method.

milestone.description: New features for 5.x, backwards compatible with 5.1.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Prior to this patch validation providers had to be used through the `RulesProvider` class to handle properly passing the context array.
Fixes #17631

In particular, make sure existing tests still pass, and add tests for all new behavior. When fixing a bug, you may want to add a test to verify the fix.

-->

issue.title: Behavior custom rules broken in 5.2

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
### Description

https://github.com/dereuromark/cakephp-captcha/actions/runs/14233317463/job/39888032852

```
ArgumentCountError: Too few arguments to function Captcha\Model\Behavior\CaptchaBehavior::validateCaptchaMaxPerUser(), 1 passed in /home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/ORM/BehaviorRegistry.php on line 285 and exactly 2 expected

/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/src/Model/Behavior/CaptchaBehavior.php:140
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/ORM/BehaviorRegistry.php:[28](https://github.com/dereuromark/cakephp-captcha/actions/runs/14233317463/job/39888032852#step:9:29)5
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/ORM/Table.php:2818
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Validation/ValidationRule.php:145
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Validation/Validator.php:3184
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Validation/Validator.php:262
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/ORM/Marshaller.php:286
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/ORM/Marshaller.php:212
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/ORM/Table.php:[29](https://github.com/dereuromark/cakephp-captcha/actions/runs/14233317463/job/39888032852#step:9:30)54
/home/runner/work/cakephp-captcha/cakephp-captcha/tests/TestCase/Model/Behavior/CaptchaBehaviorTest.php:98
```

The rule is
```php
			$validator->add('captcha_result', [
				'maxPerUser' => [
					'rule' => 'validateCaptchaMaxPerUser',
					'provider' => 'table',
					'message' => __d('captcha', 'Limit reached. Please retry later'),
					'last' => true,
				],
			]);
```
and the method for it inside the Table class:
```php
	public function validateCaptchaMaxPerUser($value, $context) {
		// If no id was provided, the captcha was dummy due to MaxRule failure
		return !empty($context['data']['captcha_id']);
	}
```

This is a regression as before 5.0/5.1 this was working fine.

### CakePHP Version

5.2

### PHP Version

8.3
